summary: This is an email chain from April 2020 forwarding notes from the Brooklyn Human Trafficking Task Force (BKHTTF) subcommittee meetings held on July 9, 2019. The notes discuss labor and shelter subcommittee activities, including training initiatives, industry outreach, and housing challenges for trafficking victims. The email is forwarded by an FBI SSA in New York.

persons.name: Anita Teekah
persons.role: Senior Director, Anti-Trafficking Program at Safe Horizon
persons.context: Author of the forwarded subcommittee notes email, detailing labor and shelter subcommittee discussions and action items for the Brooklyn Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Sonia
persons.context: Mentioned as providing an update on federal USDOL guidance for certifying T and U visas after internal clarification conversations.

connections.description: Both are members/participants in the Brooklyn Human Trafficking Task Force subcommittees, coordinating on labor trafficking training and policy updates.

events.title: BKHTTF Labor and Shelter Subcommittee Meetings
events.description: Task Force subcommittees met to discuss labor trafficking trainings, federal visa guidance, child labor trafficking identification, industry outreach (fashion, construction, hospitality, transportation), shelter capacity questionnaires, foster care issues, and hotline operations.

events.title: Next Full BKHTTF Meeting
events.description: Scheduled full Task Force meeting at KCDA (Kings County District Attorney's office) from 11am-12pm, following a cancelled August meeting.

locations: 50 Court Street, Suite 811, Brooklyn, NY 11201 (Safe Horizon office)
KCDA (Kings County District Attorney's office, location for Task Force meetings)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain discussing Brooklyn Human Trafficking Task Force subcommittee work from July 2019, forwarded by an FBI SSA in April 2020.

Labor trafficking discussions included targeting specific industries (fashion, construction, hospitality, transportation) and challenges in identifying child labor trafficking within the Hasidic community.
Shelter subcommittee notes highlight a lack of completed questionnaires from housing providers and that 98% of youth clients at Covenant House had foster care or failed adoption experience.
The email notes the August 2019 Task Force meeting was cancelled, with the next full meeting scheduled for September 10, 2019.
The correspondence shows coordination between non-profits (Safe Horizon), law enforcement (FBI), and government agencies on human trafficking response efforts in Brooklyn.
